bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, August 28, 1900
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 47. Consular. Legation of the United States. Monrovia Liberia, August 28, 1900.

p.add: BUREAU OF APPOINTMENTS. OCT 8 - 1900 Department of State

div1.p: Hon. David J Hill, Assistant Secretary, State Department Washington.
Subject. The Consular Agency at Cape Coast Castle closed.

Synopsis. In accordance to your No. 24. of Sept., 9 1899, which was duly received in due course, I immediately entered into corrispondence, first with the heir and secondly with the administrator of the estate of the late Geo. E. Eminsang, for the Archives &c
No. 47. Consular. Legation of the United States. Monrovia, Liberia, August 28, 1900.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary, State Department, Washington.

Sir: In accordance to your No. 24. Consular, of Sept. 9, 1899, relative to the closing of the Cape Coast Castle Agency &c I have the honor to report to you, that upon receipt of your instructions, I immediately entered into correspondence, first with J. E. Eminsang Esq, son of the late George E. Eminsang, and finally with the administrator of the estate of the deseased C. C. Aiken Esq., for the forwarding the Archives &c to this

this Legation. Upon my departure, on Leave of Absence, with person to visit the United States. March 23, 1900, the Archives &c, had not reached this LEgation. But upon my return, August 19, 1900, I find the Archives &c of said Cape Coast Castle Consulor Agency, in this Legation, having reached here June 26, 1900. Hence, I have the honor to inform you that said Agency is now closed.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant; Owen L. W. Smith M. R. and C. General
